intro: Eucalyptus obcordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mallees, is a species of eucalyptus native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often blue-gray in color. The tree typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It produces small, globular clusters of white or pale yellow flowers, which bloom during the summer months. The plant is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and resilient species.
